publicwhip.spmotion: * S2M-2641 Brian Adam: Scotland versus Barbarians at Pittodrie, 24 May 2005—That the Parliament welcomes the Scottish Rugby Union’s decision to hold the Scotland versus Barbarians international rugby match in Aberdeen on 24 May 2005; notes that this is the first ever rugby international to be held in Aberdeen, and hopes that a home win at Pittodrie Stadium will lead to a quick return by the Scotland team to the Granite City.
S2M-2641 Scotland versus Barbarians at Pittodrie, 24 May 2005 (lodged on 22 March 2005) Stewart Stevenson*

S2M-2641 Brian Adam: Scotland versus Barbarians at Pittodrie, 24 May 2005—That the Parliament welcomes the Scottish Rugby Union’s decision to hold the Scotland versus Barbarians international rugby match in Aberdeen on 24 May 2005; notes that this is the first ever rugby international to be held in Aberdeen, and hopes that a home win at Pittodrie Stadium will lead to a quick return by the Scotland team to the Granite City. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson
S2M-2641 Scotland versus Barbarians at Pittodrie, 24 May 2005 (lodged on 22 March 2005) Rob Gibson*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Jim Mather*, Nora Radcliffe*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mrs Nanette Milne*
S2M-2641 Scotland versus Barbarians at Pittodrie, 24 May 2005 (lodged on 22 March 2005) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-2641 Scotland versus Barbarians at Pittodrie, 24 May 2005 (lodged on 22 March 2005) Mrs Margaret Ewing*
